meanings.definition: Give a title to (a book, movie, etc.)
meanings.sent1: She enjoys intitling her stories with creative names.
meanings.sent2: The author is intitling his new novel 'The Mystery of the Lost Key'.
meanings.sent3: After intitling the movie 'The Dancing Cat', everyone wanted to watch it.
meanings.sent4: Intitling the play 'The Whispering Wind' added an air of mystery to the production.
meanings.sent5: Intitling a story can be a fun way to capture readers' attention.

meanings.definition: Entitle or give a right or claim to something
meanings.sent1: Winning the competition intitling her to a special prize.
meanings.sent2: The certificate intitling him to a free meal was proudly displayed.
meanings.sent3: Being the tallest student intitling him to reach the top shelf easily.
meanings.sent4: His hard work intitling him to a well-deserved break.
meanings.sent5: The ticket intitling her to a front-row seat made her day.
